Author: easyfrag
Content: You're introducing unnecessary complexity into the system; instead of the lock, light, and wiring between the two we would have lock, light, motion detector, and wiring between all three. It may be trivial, but ensuring fewer failure points is good design, especially at 30 000 feet.

Author: ptm
Content:
I too have instances run for 5-6 months without downtime.

The reliabilty concerns are overstated. As long as one accounts for the lack of persistent storage, there should not be a problem.
